article_text:
President Obama is setting a dangerous precedent by suspending his enforcement of laws on health care, immigration, drugs, banking and so much else, but the courts may soon be asked to throw a brushback pitch. That is, unless a rump group of backbenchers undermines the legal challenge.

Mr. Obama's practice of unilaterally waiving his duty to faithfully execute statutes has been abetted by a presumed lack of legal "standing" to contest his suspension. To the extent individuals have not suffered concrete injuries...

twitter.description: Members should let Boehner take the lead against executive excess, writes the Wall Street Journal in an editorial.
twitter.title: The Standing to Sue Obama

image.alt: Congress may soon sue Obama for failing to faithfully execute the law

Mr. Obama's practice of unilaterally waiving his duty to faithfully execute statutes has been abetted by a presumed lack of legal "standing" to contest his suspension.
That is, unless a rump group of backbenchers undermines the legal challenge.
President Obama is setting a dangerous precedent by suspending his enforcement of laws on health care, immigration, drugs, banking and so much else, but the courts may soon be asked to throw a brushback pitch.
To the extent individuals have not suffered concrete injuries...
